If you'd like to organize a sanitation workshop at your hub, here's some recommendations.
I. Agenda (Prepare to have between 2-3 hours to efficiently carrying out a successful workshop.) * Welcome and Update - 15 mins * Short Presentation - 15 to 30 mins (optional) * Divide into different stations to work on different tasks - one hour * Feedback and Clean up - 15 mins.
II. Workshop Stations
Task Description Volunteer Skill Level
Station1: Laptop Cleaning
First time
Station2: Tagging Laptop Second time
Station3: Inspection Fifth time
Station4: Repair Experienced
STATION 1. LAPTOP CLEANING LEADER'S TASKS
*Before meeting- 1. Setup the station 2. Check each cleaning kit. Refill the Alcohol and cotton swabs if needed.
*During meeting- 1. Have volunteers sign in at labdoo-oc.weebly.com 2. Briefly introduce Labdoo Flow (https://www.labdoo.org/content/about-labdoo) 3. Instructions on Clean kit and how to clean a laptop 4. Inspect the laptops and check to see if the laptop is tagged after cleaning. Yes => send the laptop goes to Station 3, Inspection. No => the laptop goes to Station 2, Tagging.
*By the end of the meeting - 1. Have members fill the feedback form. 2. Collect the cleaning kits and take the used clothe home to wash them. Remember to bring them back next time. 3. Put the uncleaned laptops back to storage.
Cleaning kit - one soft clothe, a small bottle of 91% alcohol, 10-15 cotton swabs
===========================================================
STATION 2. TAGGING LEADER'S TASKS
*Before the meeting- 1. Prepare the Labdoo ID sheets, a pair of sensors, clear masking tape, 5 black/blue pens 2. Setup the station.
*During the meeting- 1. Have volunteers sign in at labdoo-oc.weebly.com 2. Match each laptop with its power adaptor. 3. Briefly introduce Labdoo tagging procedure (https://www.labdoo.org/content/tagging-procedures) - Volunteers can following the "Sample Tagging" to enter the required fields. 4. LEADER, please verify the donor's information has been correctly input after tagging. 5. Send the tagged laptop to Station 3 for inspection.
*By the end of the meeting 1. Have members fill the feedback form. 2. Place all untagged laptops back into the box and return to the storage room.
===========================================================
STATION 3. INSPECTION LEADER'S TASKS
*Preparation before the meeting- 1.10 copies of inspection form 2. 2-3 copies of Lubuntu CD and USB 3. painter's tapes and a few markers to write
*During the meeting- 1. Have volunteers sign in at the labdoo-oc.weebly.com 2. Inspection procedures for laptops from Station 2. A. Power on the laptop and see if it has any OS installed. B. If yes, follow the steps to erase data from the laptop. C. Properly label laptop's condition with painter's tape and send to Station 4. 3. Inspection procedures for laptops from Station 3. A. Make sure the laptop condition matches the Laptop Inspection CheckList. B. Change the laptop status to S2 @ http://www.labdoo.org/laptop/LabdooID# , and add the laptop condition to the "Additional Notes" area under the "Additional Information" panel.
*By the end of the meeting - 1. Have members fill the feedback form. 2. Collect all the laptops and place them back into the storage room.
===========================================================
STATION 4. REPAIR LEADER'S TASKS
*Before the meeting- 1. 2-3 copies of current Lubuntu CD and USB 2. Separate the laptops require hardware repair from the software installation
*During the meeting- 1. Have volunteers sign in at labdoo-oc.weebly.com 2. Divide group to HW (hardware) and SW (software) 3. SW installation group - follow the software installation steps here, https://www.labdoo.org/content/sanitation-guide-simple-method . 4. If it fails to install, properly label the problem with painter's tape and send it to the HW group. 5. Send finish installation laptop back to Station 3 for inspection. 6. HW group - you know what you need to do:)
*By the end of the meeting - 1. Have members fill the feedback form. 2. Collect all the laptops and place them back into the storage room.
